SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.levels

Class EnemySpawner

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.levels.EnemySpawner
public class EnemySpawner extends Object
EnemySpawner is responsible for handling the logic of spawning enemy units in a game level.

  • Constructor Details

    • EnemySpawner

      public EnemySpawner(int totalEnemies, double spawnProbability)
      Constructor for EnemySpawner. Initializes the spawner with the total number of enemies allowed and the probability of spawning enemies.
      Parameters:
      totalEnemies - The maximum number of enemies allowed in the level at one time.
      spawnProbability - The probability of spawning an enemy unit on each game frame (0.0 to 1.0).

  • Method Details

    • spawnEnemies

      public void spawnEnemies(LevelParent level, double screenWidth, double enemyMaximumYPosition)
      Spawns enemies in the level based on the probability and the current number of enemies in the game.
      Parameters:
      level - The current level instance, used to manage the game state and add enemy units.
      screenWidth - The width of the game screen, used to position enemies horizontally.
      enemyMaximumYPosition - The maximum Y position allowed for enemies (vertical positioning).

    • getTotalEnemies

      public int getTotalEnemies()
      Retrieves the maximum number of enemies allowed in the level.
      Returns:
      The total number of enemies that can be present in the level at one time.

    • getSpawnProbability

      public double getSpawnProbability()
      Retrieves the spawn probability for enemies.
      Returns:
      The probability (0.0 to 1.0) of spawning an enemy on a given game frame.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the EnemySpawner instance, useful for debugging.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string containing the totalEnemies and spawnProbability values.
